runs.comm: length just outside off which shapes away as Charles drives this on the up, falling just short of short cover point. Would have been a terrific way to kick-start the innings
length which is hit up and over the infield for a brace
short of a length and climbing quite high as Charles has a go. Ends up being called wide because of height

full again as Charles is graced with some good fortune as this one, which was meant to be hit over the bowler's head, instead flies behind to the third man boundary, with third man unable to get anywhere near that at the pace it was coming at
on the pads as this is whipped away behind square
length just outside off which is clobbered over the bowler's head for a boundary. West Indies look to be keeping pace at the moment
back of a length as Charles goes for another waft through the leg side, but misses the ball
full and just outside off as this one is delivered at 141 kph, with Simmons getting an edge which falls just short of slip
143 kph, length just outside off which is cut straight to backward point
147 kph, length which hits Simmons on the thigh pad as he goes for a leg side hit
150 kph, beaten by pace here as Simmons looks to hit this through extra-cover, but instead succeeds in getting an edge to the keeper, who doesn't make a mess of it
145 kph, defends this one with the straightest of bats to push this down to mid-on for a single
147 kph, back of a length and cross-batted down to long-on
134 kph, full and on the pads as Fletcher eases this to the leg side
134 kph, flicks this uppishly down to deep midwicket
133 kph, defends this back of a length delivery straight back to the bowler
134 kph, lofts Southee handsomely down the ground for a boundary
129 kph, decides to abort the pull to this short one from Southee which climbs to the keeper
132 kph, tries to squeeze this past backward point, who gets hand on it, before third man completes the job
145 kph, slaps this short one straight down to long-on
145 kph, able to clear the infield with this cut behind point to the boundary
147 kph, length on middle which is hit towards mid-off, with the pair able to complete the run before the throw
143 kph, gets this one to rear back of a shortish length as Fletcher aborts his shot midway
146 kph, able to squirt this away to the squarish third man boundary for a brace
144 kph, back of a length which is slapped down to mid-off to signal the end of the over
135 kph, wide down the leg side as Neesham struggles to get his radar on track
134 kph, this time pitches it wide outside off as Charles goes for a lazy waft
fuller length ball outside off which Charles fails to get bat on ball to
138 kph, length which is driven straight to mid-off

137 kph, looks to hammer this one down the leg side, but Charles succeeds instead of getting an inside edge which carries low to Ronchi to his left to take a good catch. Neesham didn't seem too animated as he celebrated that one. West Indies lose their openers in quick time
138 kph, back of a length and played back to the bowler
140 kph, fuller one just outside off as this is dragged by Powell to the fielder at fine leg, with the pair able to squeeze in three runs
138 kph, gets a single down to third man to mark the end of the over
short of a length which is inside-edged on to the thigh pad. Able to run a quick single
147 kph, length just nipping in as the NZ fielders
145 kph, able to steer this one behind point to the third man fielder
146 kph, back of a length which strikes the top of the pads as Powell looks for the swivel pull. Goes for an appeal, but this was pitching outside the line
153 kph, fuller one which is driven straight to cover point
147 kph, back of a length which is pushed to the off side with soft hands. Are able to squeeze in a single before the throw
lofts the spinner straight away between deep midwicket and long-on
looks to turn this away to fine leg, but short fine leg is into play
again heaved through the leg side, but not too far as the run quickly to get two
dances down the track, but the ball ends up hitting the thigh pad as Powell is able to run the bye
fuller one outside off which is driven straight to short cover point
this time opens the face to run him down to short third man, and sets off for a quick single, with the batsman going for a dive at the non-striker's, and is able to make it just in time
130 kph, gets this to loop in on off as Fletcher is equal to the task
120 kph, back of a length which is pushed just to the right of the bowler
129 kph, cut away towards sweeper cover for a brace
121 kph, able to turn this one to the leg side with an uppish flick

132 kph, back of length which Powell tries to get away to the leg side, before backing up a bit too much, before Anderson has him turning back to ground his bat just in the nick of time before Anderson knocks down the stumps
pushes this to the off side to set off for a quick single. McCullum dives in from short cover, and gets to it, but is not quick enough to run out any of the West Indies batsmen
pushed to the off side for a single
steps down to try and loft him over extra-cover, but hits this straight up, with Guptill able to get under it near deep extra-cover to hold onto the chance
steered straight to short cover
low full toss which is deflected away to mid-off
squirts this one away through the gap at point to retain the strike
120 kph, solid in defence to this round the wicket line from Anderson
fuller one just outside off which Fletcher has a swing and a miss
speared in on middle and off as Fletcher is able to get this away to the leg side
on the back foot as this is played straight to backward square
full and going down the leg side as Bravo eases this down to long-on
gets a single to the leg side off the last delivery to end the over
Mattress gets a wicket as Fletcher goes for the big hit down the leg side, but instead gets this to travel over long-off for an easy catch for Jesse Ryder
length just outside off as Bravo hits this inside-out over extra-cover for a boundary
defended straight back to the bowler
steered down to long-on for a single
flicks this rather full delivery uppishly towards midwicket

Russell decides to tee off but Guptill denies him at long-on to take a magnificent catch just before the boundary. Shows off his hang time as he times the jump perfectly. The NZ fielders run over to him as Guptill
defends this length ball to the off side for none
able to play this with soft hands to the point fielder for a single
pushes this length delivery back to the bowler
turns this one away outside off down to the leg side for one
eases this latest offering down to long-on
on the back foot aa this is played down to mid-on for one
just smokes NMac over the midwicket boundary for a huge six. Got it quite close to the orange brigade of fans vying for a shot at NZD $100,000
delivers a flatter one just outside off as the batsman fails to get a shot off
clips this off his pads, but straight to the fielder at midwicket
low full toss which is clobbered down to long-on

anything you can do, I can do better. I can do everything better than you. That is probably what is going through Ryder's mind as he runs at full tilt to the right to take a good snap at the long-off boundary. Bravo looking to clear NMac down the ground, but don't underestimate Ryder, who despite his bulky appearance seems quite mobile in the field
rushes this one onto the batsman as Miller works him down the leg side for a single
136 kph, length just outside off which is drilled straight to short cover point, who makes a fine diving stop
does not hit this one at all well as Miller mistimes this over midwicket, but is lucky the ball falls safely in no-mans land
Walton looking to be aggressive as he attempts a paddle flick. but hits it straight to Munro at backward square. West Indies look down for the count at 77 for 7
fuller one just outside off which is driven straight to short cover point
and Narine doesn't bother the scorers as he lofts this straight to long-off with a good change of pace delivery. West Indies are sliding to a heavy defeat here in Auckland
spears this one down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide
pushes this one back to the bowler to mark the end of the over
back of a length and played back to the bowler
defends this one down to sweeper cover for one
full and just outside off as Badree gets a lucky outside edge which beats slip and the keeper to the third man boundary
spears a yorker on middle and leg as Badree is able to dig it out
yorker on middle which is dug out to the leg side
114 kph, another leg side delivery from Neesham as he gets this slower ball down the wrong line
hits him straight on the pad as Miller is really struggling to get anything away
this time plays it down to long-on for one
squirts this one away to the off side with soft hands for one
length ball which allows Badree to get under it and loft directly towards long-on
eases this one down to deep midwicket for a single
down the leg side once more as the umpire signals a wide
short of a length and rising as Badree fails to get bat on ball
148 kph, going down the pads as this is whipped away to deep fine leg
148 kph, going down the leg side as Milne rushes over to his right to field the ball
147 kph, heading down the pads as Badree flicks this straight to a finish deep fine leg
139 kph, driven to the off side, with the covers coming into play, as the batsmen pinch a single
141 kph, back of a length which Miller tries to cut away through point
147 kph, Miller is beaten for pace as this one rushes onto him from back of a length, with the West Indian attempting a pull
133 kph, round the wicket and onto the batsman as this is defended back to Anderson
full and just outside off as Miller looks for a single behind square
full and wide as Badree lofts this one through the air to the off side
hits this through the line down to long-off
defended back to the bowler as West Indies look to survive without being all dismissed
fuller one just outside off which is steered towards the covers for a single
fuller one on the pads which is flicked down to deep fine leg
short of a length slower ball which ends up called wide as Miller fails to get bat on ball
speared on the pads as Miller finds the gap through fine leg to get to the boundary
back of a length which Miller ducks under as this is collected by the keeper
full outside off which is carved down to third man for a single
yorker on middle which is steered down to long-off for one
lofts this one down to long-on to end the 19th over
136 kph, defends this length ball to the off side
almost yorker-length as this is played towards short cover
angled away down the leg side to deep fine leg
ful on middle and leg as this is eased down to long-on for a single
length coming in on middle and leg as this is worked down to long-on to end the match
